intro: Albizia viridis var. zygioides, commonly known as the green albizia or zygioides albizia, is a variant of the albizia genus native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky soils and arid environments. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow or cream-colored flowers in clusters. It is known for its ability to fix nitrogen through its root nodules, making it valuable in soil enrichment. The bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
